BubbleBobble.model.Collidable

Packages that use Collidable
Package
Description
BubbleBobble.model
 

  • Uses of Collidable in BubbleBobble.model

    Subclasses of Collidable in BubbleBobble.model
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Apple
    Represents an Apple object in the game, which can be collected by the hero to gain an extra life.
    class 
    Banana
    Represents a Banana object in the game, which can be collected by the hero to gain points.
    class 
    Bubble
    Represents a Bubble shot by the hero.
    class 
    BubbleBuster
    The BubbleBuster is the most basic type of monster in the game.
    class 
    Fireball
    Fireball is a projectile shot by an Incendo monster.
    class 
    FireBubble
    FireBubble is a special type of projectile shot by the hero.
    class 
    FireIcon
    FireIcon represents an item that can be collected by the hero in the game.
    class 
    Fruit
    The Fruit class represents collectible items in the game that increase the player's score when picked up.
    class 
    Giant
    MyMonster class extends the Monster class and represents a specific type of monster with unique behaviors, including shooting fireballs at random intervals, handling attacks, and drawing the attack count.
    class 
    Hero
    The Hero class represents the main character of the game.
    class 
    Incendo
    Incendo is a subclass of Monster.
    class 
    Monster
    The Monster abstract class defines the basic characteristics of any monster type in the game, including platform collisions, movement, and interactions with other game objects (e.g., Hero, Bubble, FireBubble).
    class 
    Platform
    Platform class represents a static surface in the game where other collidable objects (such as monsters or heroes) can walk on or jump through.
    class 
    Projectile
    The Projectile class serves as a superclass for various projectile types, such as bubbles and fireballs.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    Level.addCollidable(Collidable c)
    Adds a collidable object to the level.
    boolean
    Level.overlapping(Collidable c1, Collidable c2)
    Updates the state of the level based on game progress.
    void
    Level.removeCollidable(Collidable c)
    Removes a collidable object from the level.
